tutorials.tutorial: This tutorial will acquaint you with the basic Rider code editing capabilities and shortcuts.
This tutorial will acquaint you with run/debug configurations: a concept used by Rider to help you run and debug your programs.
This tutorial will acquaint you with debugging basics: how to set breakpoints, run a debug session, step through code, evaluate expressions, and add watches.
This is the second tutorial on debugging basics. Here you will learn how to debug exceptions, external code, use conditional breakpoints and the 'smart step into' feature.

This tutorial will help you get started with the Rider's version control client. You will learn how to create a Git repository, commit and explore changes, and also how to share you work using GitHub.
In this tutorial you will learn how to add unit tests to your code, execute them, and analyze their resutls.
This tutorial contains tips and tricks on how to make your work even more productive with typing assists and some other features.
